Package model

Class AbstractPuzzle

java.lang.Object
model.AbstractPuzzle
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSudoku, Str8ts
public abstract class AbstractPuzzle extends Object
Abstract base class for all puzzles like Sudoku, Killer and Str8ts that have a square grid with the constraints that each number has to be in the range from 1 to the number of rows/columns in the grid (see getGridSize()) and no duplicate values are allowed in a row/column.

This class provides the following public interface:

  • getGridSize() and getNumberOfCells() - for providing information about a puzzle
  • Cell, getCell(), setCell(), resetCell() and SetCellResult - for managing the cells of a puzzle
  • solve() and SolveResult - for solving a puzzle
  • equals() and hashCode() - for comparing puzzles

    • setCell

      public final AbstractPuzzle.SetCellResult setCell​(int row, int column, int value)
      Trys to set the value of the cell in the specified row and column to value.

      This will not work if value leads to conflicts with other cells or you try to pass something for value that is neither EMPTY_CELL nor in the valid range from 1 to gridSize (both inclusive).

      Returns:
      SetCellResult.SUCCESS if successful, SetCellResult.INVALID_VALUE if you try to use a value that is out of range or another instance of AbstractPuzzle.SetCellResult that contains the conflictingCells that are responsible for the operation to fail

    • solve

      public final AbstractPuzzle.SolveResult solve()
      Trys to solve the Puzzle.

      If the solve was successful, the Puzzle will be in a solved state, otherwise the sate will be the same as before.

      Returns:
      SolveResult.NOT_IN_VALID_STATE_FOR_SOLVE if this Puzzle is in a state that is not ready for being solved (e.g. missing groups in a Killer), SolveResult.NO_SOLUTION if this Puzzle is not solvable, SolveResult.MULTIPLE_SOLUTIONS if this Puzzle was solved but there was more than one way to do so or SolveResult.ONE_SOLUTION if this Puzzle was solved and there was exactly one way to do so

    • getNextEmptyCellForSolve

      protected AbstractPuzzle.Cell getNextEmptyCellForSolve​(int startRow, int startColumn, boolean inclusive)

    • getConflictingCells

      protected Set<AbstractPuzzle.Cell> getConflictingCells​(int row, int column, boolean getAll)

    • hasToValidateBeforeSolve

      protected abstract boolean hasToValidateBeforeSolve()
      Used to determine if there are requirements that need to be fulfilled before solving can be done. If this returns true, the requirements are then checked by isInvalid(). Implementations should just return a constant value.

    • isInvalid

      protected boolean isInvalid()
      Returns false if and only if grid is a square with gridSize * gridSize cells, every cell is either EMPTY_CELL or in the valid range from 1 to gridSize (both inclusive) and there are no conflicts.
